segment.documentation: BGM, A segment to indicate the beginning of a message and to transmit identifying number and the further specification of the message type (in data element 1001: Document name code), such as Gate-in report, Gate-out report.
DTM, A segment to indicate a date and/or time applying to the whole message, such as date and time of document or message issue.
FTX, A segment to specify free form or processable supplementary information, such as: - change information

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments to specify a reference relating to the whole message, and its date and/or time.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to express a reference which applies to the entire message, such as: - reference to previous message - container announcement reference number - release order reference - acceptance order reference
DTM, A segment to indicate date and/or time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments to indicate information relating to the main carriage stage of the transport (sea).

segment.documentation: TDT, A segment to indicate transport details related to the main carriage stage of the transport (sea), such as carrier/liner service.
DTM, A segment to specify a date and time relating to main carriage stage.
RFF, A segment to provide a reference for the liner service, such as: - conference - marketing organization - syndicate - vessel sharing agreement

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A segment group to indicate places and ports related to the main carriage stage.

segment.documentation: LOC, A segment to specify a location related to the main carriage stage such as place of arrival and place of departure.
DTM, A segment to specify the date(s) and time(s) related to a location.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments to identify a party and/or addresses and related contacts.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to identify the party's name and address, and function, such as: - message recipient - message sender - ordering customer - ordering customer agent

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments to identify a contact and its communications related to the party.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department of a message sender and/or message recipient, such as: - information contact
COM, A segment to identify a communication number of a person or department to whom communication should be directed.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments to describe the goods items (to be) stuffed in or (to be) stripped from the containers.

segment.documentation: GID, A segment to identify a goods item (to be) stuffed in or (to be) stripped from the containers.
HAN, A segment to specify handling instructions relating to the goods item, such as: - hazardous cargo - off-dimensions - Customs clearance
FTX, A segment to describe the goods item or to provide special instructions.
PIA, A segment to identify a commodity code.
MEA, A segment to specify a measurement, other than dimensions, for the goods item.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A segment group to identify transport related temperature settings.

segment.documentation: TMP, A segment to specify a temperature setting for a goods item.
RNG, A segment to specify a temperature range setting for a goods item.
SGP, A segment to identify a container in which goods are transported.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments to specify dangerous goods details related to the goods item. One goods item may be in different dangerous goods classes.

segment.documentation: DGS, A segment to indicate the dangerous goods regulations for the corresponding mode of transport, class of dangerous goods, additional dangerous goods code, UN-number and shipment flash point.
FTX, A segment to specify supplementary details related to the dangerous goods, such as: - dangerous goods technical name - dangerous goods additional information
MEA, A segment to specify measurements of the dangerous goods, such as: - net net weight.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A segment group to specify contact information including communication details regarding the dangerous goods.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department to be contacted regarding the dangerous goods.
COM, A segment to specify communication details of the contact specified in the CTA segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: COD-HAN-SG11-SG12-NAD-SG14-SG16 A group of segments to specify containers in which goods are transported.

segment.documentation: EQD, A segment to specify a container, container size and type used in the transport, and full/empty indication.
RFF, A segment to specify the identifying number associated with the container, such as: - container sequence number - booking reference number (sea)
TMD, A segment to indicate a Full Container Load (FCL) or a Less than Full Container Load (LCL).
DTM, A segment to indicate date and time relating to the delivery of a container: - actual equipment positioning date and/or time
LOC, A segment to specify ports/locations associated with the transport of a container, such as: - stowage cell - place of discharge
MEA, A segment to specify measurement, other than dimensions, associated with the container, such as: - gross weight
DIM, A segment to specify dimensions applicable to the container, such as: - external equipment dimensions
SEL, A segment to identify seal and seal issuer associated with the container, such as shipper, consolidator, carrier (sea), Customs or terminal operator.
FTX, A segment to specify processable supplementary information associated with the container, such as: - damage remarks
PCD, A segment to specify percentages related to the equipment such as percentage humidity.
EQA, A segment to identify related container and means of transport details (rail), such as: - rail car
COD, A segment to specify the details of the components of transport equipment.
HAN, A segment to specify handling instructions related to the container equipment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 11: A group of segments to specify damage details related to the equipment.

segment.documentation: DAM, A segment to specify equipment damages, such as the point of the damage on the equipment, and the type of damage.
COD, A segment to specify component details of the damaged equipment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 12: A group of segments to indicate details of the movement of containers by sea and by inland carriers, such as mode and means of transport and locations.

segment.documentation: TDT, A segment to indicate information related to the inland transport stage (road, rail or inland water), such as mode of transport, identification of the means of transport and inland carrier.
DTM, A segment to specify a date and time related to the transport details such as date and time of arrival or departure.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 13: A segment group to specify ports and other locations associated with the inland transport of containers.

segment.documentation: LOC, A segment to specify ports/locations associated with inland transport of a container, such as: - place of departure - place of arrival
DTM, A segment to specify date(s) and time(s) related to a location.
NAD, A segment to specify the actual address where a piece of equipment is to be delivered finally (final place of positioning).

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 14: A group of segments to specify dangerous goods.

segment.documentation: DGS, A segment to indicate the dangerous goods regulations which apply, the class of dangerous goods, additional dangerous goods codes, the United Nations Dangerous Goods (UNDG) number and the shipment flash point.
FTX, A segment to specify supplementary details regarding the dangerous goods such as dangerous goods technical name and dangerous goods additional information.
MEA, A segment to specify measurements of the dangerous goods, such as: - net net weight

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 15: A group of segments to specify contact information.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department to be contacted regarding dangerous goods.
COM, A segment to specify communication details of the dangerous goods contact.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 16: A segment group to identify transport related temperature settings.

segment.documentation: TMP, A segment to specify the type of transport related temperature such as storage, transport or operating temperature and also to optionally specify a single value temperature setting.
RNG, A segment to optionally specify the transport related temperature as a range of values.
CNT, A segment to specify the number of containers in the message.
